newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway's Norzink in plan to almost double capacity.
newsitem.headline: Norway's Norzink in plan to almost double capacity.

text.p: Norway's Norzink AS said on Friday its board had approved a pre-feasibility study to expand the company's capacity to about 250,000 tonnes per year of slab zinc output from 140,000 tonnes.
The company said it planned to have full capacity on stream by the beginning of the next decade.

Norzink's plant at Odda in southwest Norway produced about 135,000 tonnes of zinc in 1996, around 5,000 tonnes short of its production target because of restructuring work and disputes with unions over maintenance and restructuring plans.
Its target for 1997 is about 138,000 tonnes.
"The expansion programme will follow last year's successful implementation of an extensive cost-cutting programme," Norzink said in a statement.
It said the study would focus on critical issues such as power contracts, best available technology and environmental issues.
NORZINK is jointly owned by Rio Tinto plc and Trelleborg AB. --Tanya Pang, Oslo newsroom, +47 22 42 50 41
